content:
That's great to hear! The cast of "Minari" is indeed very down-to-earth and passionate about the film, and it's wonderful that you got to experience that firsthand.

I completely agree with you about the themes of identity and community being prominent in many of the films you watched. Those are indeed timely and universal themes that resonate with audiences worldwide. It's fascinating to see how different filmmakers approach these themes from their own unique perspectives, cultural backgrounds, and experiences.

Identity, in particular, is a complex and multifaceted theme that can be explored in many ways. From cultural heritage to personal identity, it's a topic that touches everyone's lives in some way. And community is often closely tied to identity, as our sense of belonging and connection to others can shape who we are and how we navigate the world.

It's great that you were able to appreciate the diversity of approaches to these themes across the different films you watched. Did you find that any of the films or Q&A sessions challenged your own perspectives or made you think about these themes in a new way?
